alert.note: Alert for Harrison; Pottawattamie (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 4:49AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Pottawattamie and southeastern Harrison Counties through 530 AM CDT... At 448 AM CDT, trained weather spotters reported a strong thunderstorm 4 miles northwest of Crescent, or 10 miles north of Omaha, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree branches and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Underwood around 505 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Neola, Minden and Persia. This includes the following highways... Interstate 29 between mile markers 61 and 75. Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 20 and 31. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
